intro: Haplostemma, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its large, showy night-blooming flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are white or pale yellow and emit a strong, sweet fragrance at night to attract pollinators. Haplostemma is adapted to arid environments and has a deep root system to access water.
